title: Sow in Kakamega birthed piglet with human face? Photos actually of ‘silicon sculptures for art collectors’
subtitle: It’s a series of
author: africacheck.org
vclaim:
. A giant sow lies on her side with a tiny human-like piglet (or baby?) resting near her. It’s obviously a boy, but has a pig’s snout for a nose, sharp teeth in its mouth and claws on its little hands and feet.

But the pictures aren’t what they seem.

When they first appeared online, on 26 July 2018, the images spread like wildfire. One Twitter user

the pig-human baby was born in Kenya’s Murang’a county. Another said it came from

The maybe-piglet popped up on Facebook two days later, on July 28, 2018. This time the

“breaking news” – that “a pig in Kakamega has delivered a baby boy”. They added: “Total shame to our men.”

The post has about a thousand likes and has been shared some 16,000 times, so far.

Facebook’s fact-checking system recently flagged it as false. It is.

The original photos come from the Instagram account of

, an Italian sculptor who deals in “high quality silicon sculptures for art collectors”.

on her Instagram account on 26 July 2018 with a now broken link, advertising the pieces for sale on

, an online marketplace for vintage and handmade items.

So, yes, the pig-baby photos only show sculpted objects made of silicon. (And humans and animals simply can’t make babies, as another Facebook

What we have here are real photos with a false caption, misinforming the public. The images have already been debunked by
